body: I Went 24/5/2/132 most damage in the game and didn't get an s i mean i should get an s just for playing urgot in this meta

replies.body:
It's important to note that the Mastery system uses more than just K/D/A and CS to dish out those grades (wouldn't be much use if it was so restricted), so it's entirely possible to have an impressive K/D/A and still fall short of an S grade. Kill participation, objective damage and vision score are just a few things that can contribute.

One thing I can say about this, based on the information provided, is that it seems like poor amount of CS for a 30 minute game. The general "rule of thumb" with CS (excluding Support, obviously) is that you should earn 100 CS for every 10 minutes of play (which means, ideally, 300 CS at 30 minutes). At the *very* least, you should be achieving half that (in shorter games) if you're trying to get an S grade.
Still waiting for urgot to become urgod again
0/1/15 support with 17 wards placed in a 24 min game. A+
Mastery is heavily based on your Creep Score outside of the Support position on SR/TT. For a 30 minute SR game, upwards of 150 Creep kills should net you an S with a similar KDA score.
